segment.source: Manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company (Windows 10)
segment.target: Manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company (Windows 10)

segment.source: Wi-Fi Sense automatically connects you to Wi-Fi, so you can get online quickly in more places.
segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense automatically connects you to Wi-Fi, so you can get online quickly in more places.

segment.source: Manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company
segment.target: Manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Wi-Fi Sense learns about open Wi-Fi hotspots your Windows PC or Windows phone connects to by collecting information about the network, like whether the open Wi-Fi network has a high-quality connection to the Internet.
segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense learns about open Wi-Fi hotspots your Windows PC or Windows phone connects to by collecting information about the network, like whether the open Wi-Fi network has a high-quality connection to the Internet.

segment.source: By using that information from your device and from other Wi-Fi Sense customers' devices too, Wi-Fi Sense builds a database of these high-quality networks.
segment.target: By using that information from your device and from other Wi-Fi Sense customers' devices too, Wi-Fi Sense builds a database of these high-quality networks.

segment.source: When you’re in range of one of these Wi-Fi hotspots, you automatically get connected to it.
segment.target: When you’re in range of one of these Wi-Fi hotspots, you automatically get connected to it.

segment.source: The initial settings for Wi-Fi Sense are determined by the options you chose when you first set up your PC with Windows 10.
segment.target: The initial settings for Wi-Fi Sense are determined by the options you chose when you first set up your PC with Windows 10.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Wi-Fi Sense isn’t available in all countries or regions.
segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense isn’t available in all countries or regions.

segment.source: How does Wi-Fi Sense work?
segment.target: How does Wi-Fi Sense work?

segment.source: Wi-Fi Sense connects your employees to open Wi-Fi networks.
segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense connects your employees to open Wi-Fi networks.

segment.source: Typically, these are the open (no password required) Wi-Fi hotspots you see when you’re out and about.
segment.target: Typically, these are the open (no password required) Wi-Fi hotspots you see when you’re out and about.

segment.source: How to manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company
segment.target: How to manage Wi-Fi Sense in your company

segment.source: In a company environment, you will most likely deploy Windows 10 to your employees' PCs using your preferred deployment method and then manage their settings globally.
segment.target: In a company environment, you will most likely deploy Windows 10 to your employees' PCs using your preferred deployment method and then manage their settings globally.

segment.source: With that in mind, you have a few options for managing how your employees will use Wi-Fi Sense.
segment.target: With that in mind, you have a few options for managing how your employees will use Wi-Fi Sense.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Turning off Wi-Fi Sense stops employees from connecting automatically to open hotspots.
segment.target: Turning off Wi-Fi Sense stops employees from connecting automatically to open hotspots.

segment.source: Using Group Policy (available starting with Windows 10, version 1511)
segment.target: Using Group Policy (available starting with Windows 10, version 1511)

segment.source: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by using Group Policy and your Group Policy editor.
segment.target: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by using Group Policy and your Group Policy editor.

segment.source: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using Group Policy
segment.target: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using Group Policy

originalData.data: `Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Network\WLAN Service\WLAN Settings\Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid services`

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the setting.
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the setting.

segment.source: Group Policy Editor, showing the Wi-Fi Sense setting
segment.target: Group Policy Editor, showing the Wi-Fi Sense setting

segment.source: Turn Wi-Fi Sense on (enabled) or off (disabled), based on your company's environment.
segment.target: Turn Wi-Fi Sense on (enabled) or off (disabled), based on your company's environment.

segment.source: Using the Registry Editor
segment.target: Using the Registry Editor

segment.source: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by using registry keys and the Registry Editor.
segment.target: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by using registry keys and the Registry Editor.

segment.source: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using the Registry Editor
segment.target: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using the Registry Editor

segment.source: Open your Registry Editor and go to
segment.target: Open your Registry Editor and go to

segment.source: Create and set a new DWORD (32-bit) Value named, AutoConnectAllowedOEM, with a Value data of 0 (zero).
segment.target: Create and set a new DWORD (32-bit) Value named, AutoConnectAllowedOEM, with a Value data of 0 (zero).

segment.source: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.
segment.target: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.

segment.source: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.
segment.target: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.

segment.source: For more info, see How to configure Wi-Fi Sense on Windows 10 in an enterprise.
segment.target: For more info, see How to configure Wi-Fi Sense on Windows 10 in an enterprise.

segment.source: Using the Windows Provisioning settings
segment.target: Using the Windows Provisioning settings

segment.source: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by changing the Windows provisioning setting, WiFISenseAllowed.
segment.target: You can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by changing the Windows provisioning setting, WiFISenseAllowed.

segment.source: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using WiFISenseAllowed
segment.target: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using WiFISenseAllowed

segment.source: Change the Windows Provisioning setting, WiFISenseAllowed, to 0.
segment.target: Change the Windows Provisioning setting, WiFISenseAllowed, to 0.

segment.source: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.
segment.target: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.

segment.source: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.
segment.target: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.

segment.source: For more info, see the Windows Provisioning settings reference topic, WiFiSenseAllowed.
segment.target: For more info, see the Windows Provisioning settings reference topic, WiFiSenseAllowed.

segment.source: Using Unattended Windows Setup settings
segment.target: Using Unattended Windows Setup settings

segment.source: If your company still uses Unattend, you can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by changing the Unattended Windows Setup setting, WiFiSenseAllowed.
segment.target: If your company still uses Unattend, you can manage your Wi-Fi Sense settings by changing the Unattended Windows Setup setting, WiFiSenseAllowed.

segment.source: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using WiFISenseAllowed
segment.target: To set up Wi-Fi Sense using WiFISenseAllowed

segment.source: Change the Unattended Windows Setup setting, WiFISenseAllowed, to 0.
segment.target: Change the Unattended Windows Setup setting, WiFISenseAllowed, to 0.

segment.source: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.
segment.target: Setting this value to 0 turns off Wi-Fi Sense and all Wi-Fi sense features.

segment.source: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.
segment.target: When turned off, the Wi-Fi Sense settings still appear on the Wi-Fi Settings screen, but can't be controlled by the employee and all of the Wi-Fi Sense features are turned off.

segment.source: For more info, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference topic, WiFiSenseAllowed.
segment.target: For more info, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference topic, WiFiSenseAllowed.

segment.source: How employees can change their own Wi-Fi Sense settings
segment.target: How employees can change their own Wi-Fi Sense settings

segment.source: If you don’t turn off the ability for your employees to use Wi-Fi Sense, they can turn it on locally by selecting Settings Network & Internet Wi-Fi Manage Wi-Fi settings, and then turning on Connect to suggested open hotspots.
segment.target: If you don’t turn off the ability for your employees to use Wi-Fi Sense, they can turn it on locally by selecting Settings Network & Internet Wi-Fi Manage Wi-Fi settings, and then turning on Connect to suggested open hotspots.

segment.source: Wi-Fi Sense options shown to employees if it's not turned off
segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense options shown to employees if it's not turned off

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The service that was used to share networks with Facebook friends, Outlook.com contacts, or Skype contacts is no longer available.
segment.target: The service that was used to share networks with Facebook friends, Outlook.com contacts, or Skype contacts is no longer available.

segment.source: This means:
segment.target: This means:

segment.source: The Connect to networks shared by my contacts setting will still appear in Settings Network & Internet Wi-Fi Manage Wi-Fi settings on your PC and in Settings Network & wireless Wi‑Fi Wi‑Fi Sense on your phone.
segment.target: The Connect to networks shared by my contacts setting will still appear in Settings Network & Internet Wi-Fi Manage Wi-Fi settings on your PC and in Settings Network & wireless Wi‑Fi Wi‑Fi Sense on your phone.

segment.source: However, this setting will have no effect now.
segment.target: However, this setting will have no effect now.

segment.source: Regardless of what it’s set to, networks won’t be shared with your contacts.
segment.target: Regardless of what it’s set to, networks won’t be shared with your contacts.

segment.source: Your contacts won’t be connected to networks you’ve shared with them, and you won’t be connected to networks they’ve shared with you.
segment.target: Your contacts won’t be connected to networks you’ve shared with them, and you won’t be connected to networks they’ve shared with you.

segment.source: Even if you selected Automatically connect to networks shared by your contacts when you first set up your Windows 10 device, you still won’t be connected to networks your contacts have shared with you.
segment.target: Even if you selected Automatically connect to networks shared by your contacts when you first set up your Windows 10 device, you still won’t be connected to networks your contacts have shared with you.

segment.source: If you select the Share network with my contacts check box the first time you connect to a new network, the network won’t be shared.
segment.target: If you select the Share network with my contacts check box the first time you connect to a new network, the network won’t be shared.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Wi-Fi Sense and Privacy
